chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
T: cpo
s2: Pred T
s1: Pred T

Goal:
s1 <=p s2 -> chain_closure s1 <=p chain_closure s2

Premises:
chain_closure = fun s : Pred T => [Pred p | forall t : Pred T, s <=p t -> chain_closed t -> p \In t] : Pred T -> Simpl_Pred T
Pred = fun T : Type => T -> Prop : Type -> Type Arguments Pred _%type_scope
sup_clos_mono : forall (T : lattice) (s1 s2 : Pred T), s1 <=p s2 -> sup_closure s1 <=p sup_closure s2
sup_mono : forall (T : lattice) (s1 s2 : Pred T), s1 <=p s2 -> sup s1 <== sup s2
chain_clos_sub : forall s : Pred T, s <=p chain_closure s
chain_clos_min : forall (s : Pred T) (t : Pred_Class), s <=p t -> chain_closed t -> chain_closure s <=p t
supE : forall (T : lattice) (s1 s2 : Pred T), s1 =p s2 -> sup s1 = sup s2
Mem_map_inv : ?x \In [seq ?f i | i <- ?s] -> exists y : ?T, ?x = ?f y /\ y \In ?s where ?T : [T : cpo s1 : Pred T s2 : Pred T |- Type] ?T' : [T : cpo s1 : Pred T s2 : Pred T |- Type] ?f : [T : cpo s1 : Pred T s2 : Pred T |- ?T -> ?T'] ?x : [T : cpo s1 : Pred T s2 : Pred T |- ?T'] ?s : [T : cpo s1 : Pred T s2 : Pred T |- seq ?T]
chainE : forall (T : poset) (s1 s2 : chain T), s1 = s2 < -> s1 =p s2
Mem_cat : forall (T : Type) (x : T) (s1 s2 : seq T), x \In s1 ++ s2 < -> x \In s1 \/ x \In s2
In_split : forall (T : Type) (x : T) (s : seq_PredType T), x \In s -> exists s1 s2 : seq T, s = s1 ++ x :: s2
chain_clos_idemp : forall s : Pred T, chain_closed s -> chain_closure s =p s
subp_trans : forall (T : Type) (p2 p1 p3 : Pred T), p1 <=p p2 -> p2 <=p p3 -> p1 <=p p3
subp_asym : forall (T : Type) (p1 p2 : Pred T), p1 <=p p2 -> p2 <=p p1 -> p1 =p p2
sup_clos_min : forall (T : lattice) (s : Pred T) (t : Pred_Class), s <=p t -> sup_closed t -> sup_closure s <=p t
cat = fun T : Type => fix cat (s1 s2 : seq T) {struct s1} : seq T := match s1 with | [::] => s2 | x :: s1' => x :: cat s1' s2 end : forall T : Type, seq T -> seq T -> seq T Arguments cat {T}%type_scope (_ _)%seq_scope
subp_orl : forall (T : Type) (p1 p2 q : Pred T), p1 <=p p2 -> PredU p1 q <=p PredU p2 q
subp_orr : forall (T : Type) (p1 p2 q : Pred T), p1 <=p p2 -> PredU q p1 <=p PredU q p2
subp_or : forall (T : Type) (p1 p2 q : Pred T), p1 <=p q /\ p2 <=p q < -> PredU p1 p2 <=p q
subp_and : forall (T : Type) (p1 p2 q : Pred T), q <=p p1 /\ q <=p p2 < -> q <=p (fun x : T => p1 x /\ p2 x)
Image_inj_sub : forall (A B : Type) (f : A -> B) (X1 X2 : Pred A), injective f -> [Image f i | i <- X1] <=p [Image f i | i <- X2] -> X1 <=p X2
subp_andr : forall (T : Type) (p1 p2 q : Pred T), p1 <=p p2 -> (fun x : T => q x /\ p1 x) <=p (fun x : T => q x /\ p2 x)
subp_andl : forall (T : Type) (p1 p2 q : Pred T), p1 <=p p2 -> (fun x : T => p1 x /\ q x) <=p (fun x : T => p2 x /\ q x)
subp_refl : forall (T : Type) (p : Pred T), p <=p p
sup_clos_sub : forall (T : lattice) (s : Pred T), s <=p sup_closure s
pairCPO = fun A B : cpo => CPO.Pack {| CPO.base := {| Poset.mixin := pairPosetMixin A B |}; CPO.mixin := pairCPOMixin A B |} (A * B) : cpo -> cpo -> cpo
sup_closure = fun (T : lattice) (s : Pred T) => [Pred p | forall t : Pred T, s <=p t -> t \In sup_closed -> p \In t] : forall T : lattice, Pred T -> Simpl_Pred T Arguments sup_closure {T}
chain_closed = [Pred s | bot \In s /\ (forall d : chain T, d <=p s -> lim d \In s)] : Simpl_Pred (Pred T)
dfunCPO : forall A : Type, (A -> cpo) -> cpo
CPO.poset = fun cT : cpo => Poset.Pack (CPO.class cT) cT : cpo -> poset CPO.poset is a coercion
CPO.Pack : forall sort : Type, CPO.class_of sort -> Type -> cpo
CPO.sort = fun t : cpo => let (sort, _, _) := t in sort : cpo -> Type CPO.sort is a coercion
